title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to coxstream
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to coxstream
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to coxstream
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("SignorinoY/coxstream", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to coxstream
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to coxstream
text: Please note coxstream project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)

text: goal coxstream …

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version coxstream like :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Besides estimated coefficients, can also obtain estimated baseline hazard function. following code plots estimated cumulative baseline hazard function true cumulative baseline hazard function.
code: library(coxstream) ## basic example code formula <- Surv(time, status) ~ X1 + X2 + X3 + X4 + X5 fit <- coxstream(   formula, sim[sim$batch_id == 1, ],   n_basis = 5, boundary = c(0, 3), subject_col = "patient_id" ) for (batch in 2:10) {   fit <- update(fit, sim[sim$batch_id == batch, ]) } summary(fit) #> Call: #> update.coxstream(object = fit, newdata = sim[sim$batch_id ==  #>     batch, ]) #>  #> Number of basis functions:  5  #>  #>       coef exp(coef)      se     z      p     #> X1 0.99023   2.69186 0.05042 19.64 <2e-16 *** #> X2 1.02152   2.77742 0.05334 19.15 <2e-16 *** #> X3 1.01102   2.74841 0.05337 18.94 <2e-16 *** #> X4 0.89143   2.43861 0.05173 17.23 <2e-16 *** #> X5 1.03534   2.81607 0.05054 20.48 <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>    exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95 #> X1 2.6919    0.3715     2.4386    2.9714    #> X2 2.7774    0.3600     2.5017    3.0835    #> X3 2.7484    0.3638     2.4754    3.0515    #> X4 2.4386    0.4101     2.2035    2.6988    #> X5 2.8161    0.3551     2.5505    3.1093 time <- seq(0, 3, length.out = 100) basehaz_pred <- basehaz(fit, time) basehaz_true <- cbind(time, 0.5 * time^2) plot(   time, basehaz_pred[, 2],   type = "l", lty = 2,   ylim = range(basehaz_pred[, 4], basehaz_pred[, 5]),   xlab = expression(t), ylab = expression(Lambda[0](t)),   main = "Cumulative Baseline Hazard (Estimate vs True)" ) polygon(   c(time, rev(time)), c(basehaz_pred[, 4], rev(basehaz_pred[, 5])),   col = rgb(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.4), border = NA ) lines(basehaz_true[, 1], basehaz_true[, 2]) legend("topleft", legend = c("Estimate", "True"), lty = c(2, 1))

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: function creates alias Surv function survival package, allowing used without explicitly referencing package namespace.

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
code: Surv(   time,   time2,   event,   type = c("right", "left", "interval", "counting", "interval2", "mstate"),   origin = 0 )

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: time follow-time subject. time2 ending time interval (applicable). event status indicator, normally 0=alive, 1=dead. values allowed. type Character string specifying type censoring. Possible values "right", "left", "interval", "counting". origin origin counting time, used type = "counting".

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: Surv object representing survival data.

title: Streaming Cox model with repeated observations — coxstream
code: coxstream(formula, data, n_basis, boundary, subject_col, scale = 2, ...)

title: Streaming Cox model with repeated observations — coxstream
text: formula formula expression regression models, form response ~ predictors. response must survival object returned Surv function. data data frame containing variables model. n_basis positive integer specifying number basis functions. boundary vector length 2 containing boundary knots. subject_col column name index column, used distinguish different patients. scale scaling factor pre-estimated coefficients. ... Additional arguments (used).

title: Streaming Cox model with repeated observations — coxstream
text: Additional arguments passed optimization function. object class coxstream containing fitted model. object contains following components: logLik log-likelihood fitted model. theta estimated coefficients. hessian Hessian matrix fitted model. n_basis number basis functions used. n_features number features model. n_samples number samples model. formula formula used fit model. boundary boundary knots used model. subject_col index column used distinguish different patients. scale scaling factor used model. time_stored survival times stored patient. call matched call.

title: Streaming Cox model with repeated observations — coxstream
text: Fits streaming Cox proportional hazards model accommodates repeated observations subjects. function employs nlm optimization method estimate model parameters. optimization fails converge, error raised. pre-estimation stage, parameters projected mitigate bias introduced early stage.

title: Streaming Cox model with repeated observations — coxstream
Objective Function for Optimization — objective
text: Computes objective value, gradient, Hessian penalized likelihood Cox model Bernstein polynomial bases baseline hazard. function designed use optimization routines.

title: Objective Function for Optimization — objective
code: objective(   par,   time,   status,   x,   subject,   boundary,   theta_prev,   hess_prev,   time_int )

title: Objective Function for Optimization — objective
text: par Numeric vector. Parameters optimized, including Bernstein polynomial coefficients dimension n_basis (alpha) regression coefficients (beta). time Numeric vector. Observed event censoring times. status Numeric vector. Event indicators (1 = event, 0 = censored). x Numeric matrix. Covariate data observation. subject Vector. Subject identifiers repeated measurements. boundary Numeric vector length 2. lower upper bounds Bernstein polynomial basis functions. theta_prev Numeric vector. Previous parameter estimates used proximal term, including Bernstein polynomial coefficients dimension n_basis_prev (alpha) regression coefficients (beta). number basis functions previous estimate must greater equal number basis functions current estimate. hess_prev Numeric matrix. Previous Hessian matrix used proximal term, square matrix size length(theta_prev). time_int Numeric vector. Additional time points stored named vector, names correspond subject identifiers. time points used evaluating baseline hazard function derivatives.

title: Objective Function for Optimization — objective
text: objective value attributes "gradient" "hessian".

Additional arguments (used).

title: Print method for summary.coxstream object — print.summary.coxstream
text: function prints summary coxstream model returns object x invisibly.

title: Print method for summary.coxstream object — print.summary.coxstream
text: function provides formatted output includes: Call: original function call produced model. Coefficients: regression coefficients, standard errors, z-values, p-values, formatted table. Significance stars shown next p-values signif.stars TRUE. Confidence intervals: exponentiated coefficients along confidence intervals.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) — prox_forward
text: Constructs transformation matrix map coefficients Bernstein polynomial bases one dimension another, ensuring consistency properties Bernstein polynomial bases. Note original dimension must less equal target dimension.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) — prox_forward
Proximal Operator (Forward) — prox_forward
text: p Integer. number basis functions original dimension. q Integer. number basis functions target dimension. d Integer. number features.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) — prox_forward
text: matrix representing transformation original dimension target dimension.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) — prox_forward
text: function iteratively constructs transformation matrix expanding basis functions p q, preserving mathematical properties Bernstein polynomials.

title: Simulated Stream Survival Data — sim
text: dataset containing simulated survival data 1000 patients arriving 10 batches. patient may multiple observations across batches, total number observations 1500. Covariates dimension \(5\) drawn multivariate normal distribution mean zero covariance matrix \(\Sigma\), \(\Sigma_{ij} = \rho^{|-j|}\) (\(\rho = 0.3\)). hazard function depends covariates \(\bfbeta = (1, \ldots, 1)^{\top}\), baseline hazard function \(\lambda_{0}(t) = t\). maximum follow-time fixed 3.

title: Simulated Stream Survival Data — sim
text: data frame 1500 rows 10 variables: batch_id index batch, ranging 1 10. record_id index observation, ranging 1 1500. patient_id index patient, ranging 1 1000. time survival time. status event status, 0=censored, 1=event. X1 Covariate 1. X2 Covariate 2. X3 Covariate 3. X4 Covariate 4. X5 Covariate 5.

title: Summary method for coxstream object — summary.coxstream
text: object class "summary.coxstream", containing following components: call matched call. coefficients matrix one row coefficient, columns containing coefficient, hazard ratio (exp(coef)), standard error, Wald statistic, P value. conf.int matrix one row coefficient, containing confidence limits exp(coef).

title: Update the coxstream with new data. — update.coxstream
code: # S3 method for class 'coxstream' update(object, newdata, n_basis = "auto", alpha = 1, nu = 0.2, ...)

title: Update the coxstream with new data. — update.coxstream
text: object coxstream object. newdata data.frame containing new data update model. must include variables specified original model formula. n_basis Either numeric value specifying number basis functions "auto" automatically determine number basis functions based sample size scaling parameters. Defaults "auto", means number basis functions determined n_basis = round(alpha * n_samples^nu). alpha positive numeric value controlling growth rate number basis functions n_basis = "auto". Defaults 1.0. nu positive numeric value controlling scaling exponent determining number basis functions n_basis = "auto". Defaults 0.2. ... Additional arguments passed optimization function.

title: Update the coxstream with new data. — update.coxstream
text: object class coxstream.
